item.title: LEGO Voyagers adds Switch 2 version
item.content:encoded:
• Switch 2

Due out alongside the other versions on September 15.

Cooperative adventure game LEGO Voyagers will launch for Switch 2 alongside its previously planned PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, Switch, and PC (Steam, Epic Games Store) versions on September 15, publisher Annapurna Interactive and developer Light Brick Studio announced.

The Switch 2 version is currently available for pre-order via Nintendo eShop for $24.99.

Here is an overview of the game, via Annapurna Interactive:

About

From the makers of LEGO Builder’s Journey comes a new two-player cooperative adventure about friendship and play. When two friends make it their mission to rescue an abandoned spaceship, they embark on a journey beyond their wildest dreams, ultimately learning the value of being connected.

  • Experience what it feels like to be a LEGO brick. Tumble, jump, snap together, and build your way through rich brick worlds.
  • Unravel a poetic, non verbal narrative, set in beautiful brick built environments, supported by an atmospheric soundtrack.
  • Cooperatively solve the game’s many challenges and discover how two bricks are better than one. Play locally on the same screen, or online.
  • Invite a friend to join your adventure for free with the Friend’s Pass. As long as one of you owns LEGO Voyagers, you can both play the full co-op experience together.

LEGO Voyagers asks open questions about building friendships, sharing dreams, and giving space.

It reminds us that while playing and being creative is for all shapes and sizes, it’s always better when you share it with a friend.

item.title: Katanaut now available, published by Acclaim
item.content:encoded:
• PC

A side-scrolling roguelite action game with Metroidvania elements.

Katanaut, a side-scrolling roguelite action game with Metroidvania elements developed by Voidmaw, is now available for PC via Steam for a launch discount price of $14.39 under newly revealed publisher Acclaim, the company announced.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

Katanaut is an action roguelite with Metroidvania elements. You fight your way through a collapsing space station where handcrafted rooms blend with procedural generation, offering fresh challenges on every run.

Master fluid, fast-paced combat combining melee strikes, ranged attacks, and a large pool of unlockable abilities. Uncover hidden secrets, face deadly enemies, and survive against escalating bosses in a world where cyberpunk technology meets eldritch cosmic horror.

No checkpoints. Each death sends you back to try again, armed with new knowledge and abilities to forge a unique path through the chaos. Explore, adapt, and conquer as the station shifts with every run, hiding mysteries waiting to be uncovered.

Key Features

  • Diverse Builds – Experiment with different weapons, guns, and abilities to create a strategy that matches your style, or something completely unexpected.
  • Fluid and Fast-Paced Combat – Experience a unique mixture of hand-crafted and procedurally generated levels where it could be a quick and easy run, or an intense onslaught of surprises.
  • Unlockable Arsenal – Roguelites aren’t roguelites without unlockable items! Katanaut offers a vast number of weapons, skills, and perks waiting to be discovered and upgraded.
  • High-Stakes Combat – Got quick reflexes? We serve up speedy fights where playing smart and thinking quick can make all the difference.
  • Pixel-Perfect Design – Experience a pixel-art universe where all the details were refined and designed by hand. All to inspire the unsettling beauty of this cosmic nightmare!
  • Synthwave Soundtrack – Our soundtrack brings immersive energy to every battle and simultaneously aims to paint the vibe of the station’s darkest corners—all made by one immensely talented musician!
  • Evolving Abilities and Perks – Gather currency to unlock powerful skills, passive enhancements, and game-changing perks that shape each run.
  • Hidden Secrets and NPC Interactions – Discover hidden areas, mysterious NPCs, and elite challenges that reward keen exploration and curiosity.

Watch a new trailer below.

item.title: SSX-inspired arcade snowboarding game HYPERYuki: Snowboard Syndicate announced for consoles, PC
item.content:encoded:
Publisher Acclaim and RKGK / Rakugaki developer Wabisabi Games have announced HYPERYuki: Snowboard Syndicate, an arcade snowboarding game inspired by classics like Coolboarders and SSX. It will launch for unspecified consoles and PC via Steam in 2026.

Here is an overview of the game, via Acclaim:

About

HYPERYuki: Snowboard Syndicate, from Wabisabi Games (RKGK / Rakugaki), is a high-speed, trick-fueled snowboarding bonanza wrapped in a slick, retro-futurist Y2K aesthetic. Inspired by 90s legends like Cool Boarders and SSX, you’ll shred through eight over-the-top courses packed with chances to pull off jaw-dropping tricks—all set to an electrifying soundtrack featuring YMCK, Trasto NueveVidas, and more.

  • ❮
  • ❯

Key Features

  • Three game modes:
    • Challenge – HYPERYuki’s main game mode, where players must complete certain challenges in each level in order to progress.
    • Race – Race against players or NPCs across each track
    • Chill – Enjoy a calm experience, hanging around the tracks, enjoying the view, with an endless mode.
  • Take to the slopes and turn your best friends into sworn rivals in couch and online multiplayer.
  • Climb to the top of the multiplayer mountain with online leaderboards.
  • Four playable characters at launch, with 8 more unlocked through game progression.
  • Customize your racer with a wealth of unlockable snowboard designs, jackets, boots, and headgear.
  • An energetic soundtrack featuring music from Legendary Japanese Chiptune Band YMCK, Mexican electronic musician Trasto NueveVidas, and Tekken and Ace Combat Series composer Yusuke Yamauchi.
  • Master eight challenging courses, each teeming with rails, ramps, and more to take advantage of as you bomb your way to the finish line.

Watch the announcement trailer below. View the first screenshots at the gallery.

item.title: Metrioidvania game The Prisoning: Fletcher’s Quest to be published by Acclaim
item.content:encoded:
Acclaim will publish Elden Pixels-developed Metrioidvania game The Prisoning: Fletcher’s Quest when it launches for unspecified consoles and PC via Steam in 2026, the company announced.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

Step into the mind of Fletcher Howie Jr, a game developer on the brink of physical and emotional burnout during the final stages of an intense project. After a visit to the psychologist that goes horribly wrong, you must escape your perilous mental prison in a Metroidvania drenched in anxiety based on a very true story developed by the Metroidvania masters behind Alwa’s Awakening, Alwa’s Legacy, and A Void Hope.

Features

  • Explore procedurally generated Metroidvania that incorporates player feedback to shape the world you explore and the creatures you encounter.
  • Find and defeat the five prison gang leaders, or become their friend!
  • A uniquely mature adventure that deals with themes of anxiety and psychoanalysis.
  • Navigate the hazardous recesses of Fletcher’s mind while rocking out to a pumping chiptune soundtrack
  • Fast-paced precision platforming through a wealth of unique worlds created by Fletcher’s deepest fears and anxieties.
  • Full-frontal pixel nudity!

Watch a new trailer below.
